meanings.definition: A thing that blocks one's way or prevents or hinders progress.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was a big obstacle on the path.
meanings.sent2: The construction site had an obstacle that required careful navigation.
meanings.sent3: Trying to carry all the groceries in one trip was quite an obstacle.
meanings.sent4: Miscommunication acted as an obstacle in their relationship.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog became an insurmountable obstacle for the lost hikers.

meanings.definition: Something that impedes or stands in the way of progress.
meanings.sent1: The lack of funding was a major obstacle for the project.
meanings.sent2: Overcoming obstacles is a crucial part of personal growth.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected rainstorm presented an obstacle to their picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: Fear can sometimes be an invisible obstacle to success.
meanings.sent5: The locked door was a frustrating obstacle for the escape room participants.

meanings.definition: A difficulty or problem that prevents or slows down progress.
meanings.sent1: Time management can be an obstacle for students balancing work and school.
meanings.sent2: The technical glitch posed an unexpected obstacle during the presentation.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting his passport at home was a silly obstacle to their vacation.
meanings.sent4: Lack of experience can sometimes be a significant obstacle in job interviews.
meanings.sent5: The steep hill proved to be a challenging obstacle for the marathon runners.
